As a simple test, the reduction procedures can be applied to the BPM
fusion cross section Canto et al. (2009b, 2015b).
The procedure is successful if reduced cross sections for systems in
different mass ranges are very similar.
Further, if the procedure leads to a universal function, the reduced
cross-sections should be very close to it.
We applied this test to the two versions of the fusion function method,
Eqs. (55) and (56).

Despite this system dependence, the fusion method has been widely used in

reduction method, the fusion functions are renormalized to avoid system
dependencies arising from the inaccuracy of the Wong formula Canto et al. (2009b).

As a simple test, the reduction procedures can be applied to the BPM

cross-sections should be very close to it.
